OpenAI tapped $AVGO to build its first AI processor in a multibillion-dollar deal to deploy 10 gigawatts of compute over the next four years.

Broadcom is becoming the AI highway of the new digital economy, connecting chips, data & compute at global scale.

Kind of wild how I clicked on an article about the AI Utility theme this morning because the title caught my eye & halfway through realized I was the expert the journalist was quoting.

Here are my favorite three ways to play the theme right now: 

1. $IREN is turning 3.5¬¢ renewable power into live AI compute
2. $NBIS is the closest thing to an AI utility with locked-in hyperscaler contracts & cheaper power driving every GPU hour.
3. $CIFR is the landlord of the GPU boom renting power & rack space to hyperscalers chasing capacity.

HOW $GOOGL BUILT A $3T EMPIRE

Search monetized attention, Cloud monetized compute and Gemini runs on two decades of data and scale no one else can match. 

Next, Gemini will monetize intelligence itself through tokens that price every AI interaction across its ecosystem.

$TSM just laid out the roadmap to a $1T semiconductor market by 2030.

Data center AI accelerators lead today but by decade‚Äôs end AI PCs, smartphones & robotics will be the volume drivers powering silicon demand.

We‚Äôre still so early in AI.

Global $ money supply growth has slowed with the recent rise in the dollar but US money supply continues to expand at over a 7% annualized rate.
OpenAI has now committed to up to 26GW of chips between Nvidia $NVDA, AMD $AMD and Broadcom $AVGO.

OpenAI and Broadcom $AVGO signed a deal to develop 10 GW of custom chips to be deployed in OpenAI-owned and third-party data centers. 

Broadcom will begin deploying the AI accelerator racks in the second half of 2026, and finish by 2029.

$NVDA $AMD $MSFT $ORCL

Entergy says it has received increased interest from data center companies to build in Louisiana following its deal to power Meta‚Äôs $META 2GW data center. 

CEO Phillip May says interest spans from >100MW to GW-scale projects.
